intro: Echinosepala longipedunculata, commonly known as the long peduncle echinosepal, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its elongated peduncles and distinctive echinosepal structures, which are spiny projections on the sepals. It typically grows in moist, tropical environments and produces showy flowers with five petals. The botanical features of Echinosepala longipedunculata make it an interesting subject for botanical study and horticultural interest.
